result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest D Moore Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-06-2017 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.
If the defendant commits no new crimes, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.  Nonpayment of costs and surcharges will not be a factor for expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest D Moore Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-06-2017 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Appeal rights given.  If the defendant commits no new crimes, Court will grant expungement after 1 year.  Nonpayment of costs and surcharges will not be a factor for expungement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Statements made by defense counsel.  Court denied defense motion to reconsider.  Case passed.
STATE'S RESPONSE TO DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO RECONSIDER JUDGMENT.
Defendant Ernest Moore's Notice of Motion to Reconsider Judgment, received and filed
Original MOTION HEARING Transcript (26 pages) commencing DECEMBER 1, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 21.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with Solomon Gatton appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Motion Proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Chad Boyack, MPD.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Therefore, the court DENIED defense motion. Defense requests case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing to follow case 15CM3615. Court grants defense request.   Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  This case was calendared for a motion hearing during Branch 24's pretrial week.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.

NOTE:  The defendant appeared at 10:00 am and was given the new court date.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Filed:
*  Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress.

Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a motion hearing date.  Court ordered defense motion to be filed by May 7, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ernest D Moore in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Ernest D Moore in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ernest D Moore Jr.
Current: 7845 N 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 04-03-2015)
Prior: 2607 N. 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
